subject: Languages
title: The Church Brings Latin to English
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Church Brings Latin to English.

hook.text: When Augustine arrived in 597 AD to convert the English, he imported a new vocabulary too.

buildup.text: Latin was the language of the church, education, and written records across Europe.

discovery.text: Words like 'school,' 'master,' and 'verse' entered English directly from Latin monks.

twist.text: English absorbed Latin vocabulary but refused to become Latin â€” unlike French or Spanish.

climax.text: This habit of absorbing words without changing structure defines English to this day.

punchline.text: English doesn't borrow words. It mugs other languages in dark alleys.

quiz.question: Who brought Latin vocabulary into early English?
